皨字的基本解释

皨
xīng
古同“星”。

皨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xīng］
［《廣韻》桑經切，平青，心。］
亦作“曐1”。“皨1”的今字。
(1)宇宙间发射或反射光的天体，如恒星、行星、卫星、彗星等。一般指夜空中发光的天体。
(2)星宿名。二十八宿之一。南方朱鸟七宿的第四宿。
(3)泛指二十八宿。
(4)木、火、金、水、土五星的总称。
(5)天文；星象。
(6)指星相术。
(7)分星，指分星所应的地域。
(8)借指年。
(9)夜。
(10)形容多而分散或分散。参见“星居”、“星處”。
(11)斑白。多指鬓发。
(12)像流星一样。形容迅疾。参见“星行電征”、“星流”、“星飛”等。
(13)形容明丽、璀灿。参见“星眸”。
(14)指与帝王有关的事物。参见“星輿”、“星騎”、“星闈”。
(15)指细小之物。
(16)形容细小。犹点。
(17)秤杆上标记斤、两、钱的小点。
(18)喻事业上（多指文艺、体育方面）有突出成就的人。
(19)用以表示等级。
(20)量词。用于金、银。
(21)量词。用于细小之物。多与

皨字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【白字部】　皨； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页789第28
【字彙補】古文星字。註詳日部五畫。

皨字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
皨字的起名意思

暂无。

Yan
Basic explanation of words
Yan
xīng
Gu Tong "star".
Yan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xīng］
["Guangyun" Sang Jing cut, flat green, heart. ]
Also known as "曐1". The present character for "皨1".
(1) Celestial bodies that emit or reflect light in the universe, such as stars, planets, satellites, comets, etc. Generally refers to the luminous celestial body in the night sky.
(2) The name of the stars. One of twenty-eight nights. The fourth lodging of the southern vermilion bird seven lodgings.
(3) Generally refers to twenty-eight nights.
(4) The general term for the five stars of wood, fire, gold, water, and earth.
(5) Astronomy; astrology.
(6) Refers to astrology.
(7) Distributing stars refers to the regions where the stars should be divided.
(8) Borrow refers to the year.
(9) Night.
(10) Describes many and scattered or scattered. See "Star Residence", "Star Place".
(11) Mottled white. Multi-fingered sideburns.
(12) Like a meteor. Describe fast. See "Star Travel", "Star Stream", "Star Flying", etc.
(13) Describe bright and bright. See "Star Eyes".
(14) Refers to things related to the emperor. See "Xing Yu", "Xing Qi", "Xing Wei".
(15) Refers to small things.
(16) Describe small. Still a little bit.
(17) Mark the small dots of Jin, Liang, and Qian on the weighing rod.
(18) Yu has outstanding achievements in his career (mostly in literature and sports).
(19) Used to indicate grade.
(20) Quantifiers. Used for gold and silver.
(21) Quantifiers. Used for small things. More with
Yan
